title.en: KVS NVS Teaching and Non-Teaching Recruitment 2025

description: Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan (KVS) and Navodaya Vidyalaya Sangathan (NVS) have issued a combined recruitment notification for teaching and non-teaching posts for 2025. The announcement covers extensive vacancy lists across Group A, B and C posts, eligibility criteria, important dates, fee structures, age limits, and post-wise selection procedures. Candidates should carefully read the full notification and related corrigenda before applying.
educationalQualifications: Qualifications vary by post. Ranges from 10th/12th with specified diplomas for non-teaching and PRT posts, to Bachelor’s, Postgraduate and professional qualifications with B.Ed/CTET/experience requirements for PGT/TGT/Group A positions. See 'Qualifications' section below for post-wise details.
ageLimit: Age limits vary by post (see Age Limits section). Age as on 04 December 2025. Age relaxation as per rules.
applicationFee: Varies by post and category (see Fee Structure section).

items.Assistant Commissioner / Principal: Gen / OBC / EWS: ₹2800, SC / ST / PH / ESM: ₹500
items.PGT / TGT / PRT / AE / Finance Officer: Gen / OBC / EWS: ₹2000, SC / ST / PH / ESM: ₹500
items.AO / Librarian / ASO / Jr Translator: Gen / OBC / EWS: ₹2000, SC / ST / PH / ESM: ₹500
items.Sr Secretariat Assistant / Stenographer: Gen / OBC / EWS: ₹1700, SC / ST / PH / ESM: ₹500
items.Jr Secretariat Assistant / Lab Attendant: Gen / OBC / EWS: ₹1700, SC / ST / PH / ESM: ₹500

items.Assistant Commissioner (Group A): Master's Degree with 50% marks + B.Ed (50%); experience as Principal/eligible cadre; see notification for full criteria
items.Principal (Group A): Master's Degree with 50% marks and B.Ed with 50% marks; appropriate experience
items.Vice-Principal: Master's Degree with 50% marks and B.Ed with 50% marks; working as PGT/lecturer or equivalent
items.PGT (All Subjects including Hindi/Englis: Master's Degree in relevant subject with 50% marks plus B.Ed (or specified integrated/teacher education qualification) OR as per subject-specific relaxation/requirements; CTET/other requirements where indicated
items.TGT (Subject-wise including Hindi/Englis: Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject/combination with 50% marks plus B.Ed OR Master’s with specified marks + B.Ed as applicable; CTET Paper-II pass where specified
items.PRT / Primary Teachers / Special Educato: 12th with 50% marks + D.Ed / Diploma in Elementary Education / B.El.Ed OR equivalent; CTET Paper-I pass where specified
items.Administrative Officer (Non-Teaching): Bachelor’s Degree in any stream with 3 years experience (post dependent)
items.Finance Officer (FO): B.Com (50%) with 4 years experience OR Master's in Commerce (50%) with 4 years experience
items.Assistant Engineer (AE): B.E / B.Tech in Civil/Electrical (with 2 years experience where specified)
items.Junior Translator: Master’s Degree in Hindi with English elective at degree level OR Master’s in English with Hindi elective; 2 years experience
items.Sr Secretariat Assistant / Jr Secretaria: Graduation (Sr: with 3 years experience), Jr: 12th + typing (English 30 WPM OR Hindi 25 WPM)
items.Stenographer Grade I/II: Bachelor’s Degree; shorthand and typing speed criteria as specified

description: The Oriental Insurance Company Ltd. (OICL) has released the Administrative Officer (AO) Recruitment 2025 notification, offering opportunities for Generalist and Hindi Officer positions. The announcement includes key details such as exam dates, eligibility criteria, application fees, age requirements, selection stages, and emoluments. Candidates aiming for a career in the insurance sector should review the information carefully before applying online.
educationalQualifications: AO Generalist: Graduation in any discipline with 60% marks (55% for SC/ST). AO Hindi Officer: Postgraduate Degree in Hindi/English with 60% marks (55% for SC/ST).
ageLimit: 21–30 Years as on 30 November 2025. Candidates must be born between 01 December 1995 and 30 November 2004. Age relaxation applicable as per rules.
applicationFee: General / OBC / EWS: ₹1000/-. SC / ST / PH: ₹250/-.

additionalDetails.additionalInfo: Candidates are advised to refer to the official notification for detailed exam patterns, marking schemes, and service conditions.

items.Total Emoluments: Approx. ₹85,000 per month in metro cities
items.Other Benefits: Pension (NPS), Gratuity, LTS, Medical Facilities, Group Accident Insurance

items.Generalist: UR: 123, OBC: 68, SC: 42, ST: 24, EWS: 28, Total: 285
items.Hindi (Rajbhasha) Officers: UR: 7, OBC: 4, SC: 2, ST: 1, EWS: 1, Total: 15

description: Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) has announced the Deputy Judge Attorney General Recruitment 2025. The notification provides complete information on eligibility criteria, vacancy distribution, age limits, application fees, and the multi-stage selection process. Candidates with a law background and relevant professional experience are encouraged to review all requirements carefully before submitting their online application.
educationalQualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Law (LLB) with 7 years of experience OR a Postgraduate Degree in Law with 5 years of experience.
ageLimit: Maximum Age: 40 Years as on 31 December 2025. Age relaxation applicable as per ITBP rules.
applicationFee: General / OBC / EWS: ₹400/-. SC / ST / ESM / All Females: ₹0 (Nil).

additionalDetails.additionalInfo: Candidates should read the official notification for detailed service conditions, physical standards, and exam pattern.

description: Bharat Dynamics Limited has released the Management Trainee Recruitment 2025, offering opportunities across technical and non-technical disciplines. This notification highlights crucial details including eligibility, discipline-wise vacancies, age limits, application fees, pay structure, and the complete selection procedure. Candidates intending to join BDL as Management Trainees should carefully review the instructions and requirements before applying online.
educationalQualifications: MT Engineering: 1st Class B.E/B.Tech in relevant engineering disciplines. MT Finance: CA/ICWA or First Class MBA (Finance). MT Human Resources: 1st Class MBA or PG Degree/Diploma in HR/PMIR/Personnel Management/Industrial Relations/Social Sciences.
ageLimit: MT Finance: Max 28 Years. Other MT Streams: Max 27 Years. Age as on 25 November 2025. Age relaxation applicable as per BDL rules.
applicationFee: General / OBC / EWS: ₹500/-. SC / ST / PH / ESM / BDL Employees: ₹0 (Nil).

additionalDetails.additionalInfo: Candidates must refer to the official notification for complete eligibility, service conditions, and training details.

items.Basic Benefits: DA and HRA as applicable; company accommodation at Bhanur Unit where HRA is not applicable.
items.Perks: 33% on Basic Pay and Performance Related Pay as per company policy.
items.Other Facilities: PF, Gratuity, Medical facilities, Pension, and Post Superannuation Medical Benefits under Defined Contributory Scheme.
items.During Training: Stipend combines minimum Basic Pay of Grade-II (₹40,000), DA at 51.8%, HRA, and 20% of Basic Pay as perks.
items.Note: Benefits apply after absorption as Assistant Manager. No pay protection on joining as MT.

items.MT (Engineering Discipline): 1st Class B.E/B.Tech in Electronics, Mechanical, Electrical, CS, Metallurgy, Chemical, Civil or related fields
items.MT (Human Resources): 1st Class MBA or PG Degree/Diploma in HR, PM&IR, Personnel Management, Industrial Relations, Social Science, Social Welfare, Social Work

title.en: CBSE Group A, B & C Posts Recruitment 2025

description: CBSE has released the recruitment notification for Group A, B, and C posts for the 2025–26 cycle. The announcement includes detailed information regarding eligibility criteria, post-wise qualifications, vacancy distribution, application fees, age limits, and the multi-stage selection process. Interested candidates should thoroughly review all guidelines before applying online for their respective posts.
educationalQualifications: Qualifications vary by post: Assistant Secretary requires a Bachelor's Degree; Assistant Professor & AD requires a Postgraduate Degree with minimum 55%; Accounts Officer requires Bachelor’s/PG Degree in relevant commerce/finance fields or MBA (Finance)/CA/ICWA; Superintendent requires a Bachelor's Degree with typing skills; JTO requires PG with Hindi/English; Junior Accountant & Junior Assistant require 12th with specified subjects and typing skills.
ageLimit: Assistant Secretary: 18–35 Years, Assistant Professor: 18–30 Years, Accounts Officer: 18–35 Years, Superintendent: 18–30 Years, Jr Translation Officer: 18–30 Years, Junior Accountant: 18–27 Years, Junior Assistant: 18–27 Years. Age as on 22 December 2025. Age relaxation as per CBSE norms.
applicationFee: Group A: Gen/OBC/EWS ₹1750. Group B & C: Gen/OBC/EWS ₹1050. SC/ST/ESM/PH/All Female: ₹250.

additionalDetails.additionalInfo: Applicants should thoroughly review the official notification for detailed eligibility, exam pattern, and document requirements.

items.Accounts Officer: Bachelor’s/PG Degree in Commerce/Finance/Business Studies or MBA (Finance)/CA/ICWA
items.Superintendent: Bachelor’s Degree, Computer Knowledge, Typing (Eng 35 WPM / Hindi 30 WPM)
items.Junior Accountant: 12th Pass with listed commerce/finance subjects + Typing

items.Assistant Secretary: SC:1, ST:0, OBC:3, EWS:1, UR:3, Total:8
items.Assistant Professor & AD (Academics): SC:2, ST:1, OBC:2, EWS:1, UR:6, Total:12
items.Assistant Professor & AD (Training): SC:1, ST:0, OBC:2, EWS:0, UR:5, Total:8

items.Junior Assistant: SC:5, ST:3, OBC:10, EWS:3, UR:14, Total:35

description: State Bank of India has released the Specialist Officer (SO) Recruitment 2026, offering professional positions across wealth management and customer relationship roles. The notification outlines essential details such as eligibility criteria, vacancy distribution, age limits, application fees, and the selection stages. Candidates aiming for specialist banking roles should review all instructions thoroughly before submitting their online applications.
educationalQualifications: Graduation Degree required. VP Wealth (SRM): 6 Years Experience, AVP Wealth (RM): 3 Years Experience, Customer Relationship Executive: Graduation only.
ageLimit: VP Wealth (SRM): 26–42 Years, AVP Wealth (RM): 23–35 Years, Customer Relationship Executive: 20–35 Years. Age as on 01 May 2025. Age relaxation applicable as per SBI rules.
applicationFee: General / OBC / EWS: ₹750/-, SC / ST / PH (Divyang): ₹0/-

additionalDetails.additionalInfo: Applicants should read the official notification carefully to understand eligibility, job roles, and required experience.

items.VP Wealth (SRM) Backlog: SC: 15, ST: 10, OBC: 17, EWS: 0, UR: 0, Total: 42
items.AVP Wealth (RM) Regular: SC: 33, ST: 15, OBC: 52, EWS: 20, UR: 82, Total: 202
items.AVP Wealth (RM) Backlog: SC: 0, ST: 4, OBC: 0, EWS: 0, UR: 0, Total: 4
items.Customer Relationship Executive Regular: SC: 47, ST: 21, OBC: 73, EWS: 28, UR: 115, Total: 284

description: CBSE has announced the CTET February 2026 examination, providing eligibility for teaching positions across primary and upper primary levels. This notification includes complete details related to exam dates, application schedule, fee structure, qualification requirements, and exam patterns. Candidates should carefully review all information before applying to ensure they meet the eligibility criteria.
educationalQualifications: Level-1: 12th with D.Ed / JBT / B.El.Ed / B.Ed. Level-2: Graduation with B.Ed / B.El.Ed.
ageLimit: No specific age limit is prescribed for CTET as per CBSE guidelines.
applicationFee: Single Paper: Gen/OBC (NCL) ₹1000, SC/ST/PH ₹500. Both Papers: Gen/OBC (NCL) ₹1200, SC/ST/PH ₹600.

additionalDetails.additionalInfo: Candidates must verify their eligibility and exam pattern carefully before applying online.

items.Level-1 (Class 1–5): 12th Passed with D.Ed / JBT / B.El.Ed / B.Ed

description: RITES has released the Assistant Manager Recruitment 2025, offering positions across various technical disciplines. The notification covers complete details including eligibility criteria, important dates, vacancy distribution, application fees, and the selection process. Interested candidates must review all instructions carefully before applying online.
educationalQualifications: B.E / B.Tech in relevant engineering fields or B.Pharma with a minimum of 2 years of professional experience.
ageLimit: Maximum Age: 40 Years as on 25 December 2025. Age relaxation applies as per RITES recruitment guidelines.
applicationFee: General / OBC: ₹600/-, SC / ST / EWS: ₹300/-, PH (Divyang): ₹300/-

additionalDetails.additionalInfo: Applicants should thoroughly read the official notification to ensure eligibility and accuracy before submitting the online form.

description: The Railway Recruitment Board has announced the 2025 recruitment for Junior Engineer, Depot Material Superintendent, and Chemical & Metallurgical Assistant positions. The notification covers updated vacancies, application timelines, eligibility rules, exam stages, and other essential details. Candidates across India can apply online and should review all instructions carefully before submitting their forms.
educationalQualifications: Diploma or Degree in the relevant engineering discipline. Candidates should refer to the official advertisement for stream-wise qualification requirements.
ageLimit: Age requirement is 18 to 33 years as of 01 January 2026. Additional age relaxation will be provided according to RRB recruitment rules.
applicationFee: General / OBC / EWS: ₹500/-, SC / ST / EBC / ESM / All Female / Minorities / Third Gender: ₹250/-. A refund of ₹400 (Gen/OBC) and ₹250 (others) will be credited after appearing in CBT Stage-I.

additionalDetails.additionalInfo: Applicants should read the complete notification for accurate details on eligibility, important dates, age criteria, examination structure, and other key instructions.
